pr_title: CAM-12024: configure telemetry via Java and Rest API

timeline.message:
feat(engine/rest): expose telemetry configuration in Java/REST API

* add openapi documentation

Related to CAM-12024

+  /** Enable/disable telemetry */

timeline.body:
```suggestion
  void enableTelemetry(boolean enabled);
```
The term `configure` makes from my point of view only sense if there is more to specify than just enable or disable the feature. If we used a fluent builder pattern instead, I would go for `configure` otherwise `enable`.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
void configureTelemetry(boolean enabled);
void enableTelemetry(boolean enabled);

The term configure makes from my point of view only sense if there is more to specify than just enable or disable the feature. If we used a fluent builder pattern instead, I would go for configure otherwise enable.
timeline.author: tasso94

timeline.body: Since we discussed to always insert the property into the database on engine startup, it would be more performant just to update the property and not go again through the exclusive lock logic. Also, no `OptimisticLockingException` is thrown with the exclusive lock approach, which is counterintuitive for the user.
timeline.bodyText: Since we discussed to always insert the property into the database on engine startup, it would be more performant just to update the property and not go again through the exclusive lock logic. Also, no OptimisticLockingException is thrown with the exclusive lock approach, which is counterintuitive for the user.
timeline.bodyHTML: Since we discussed to always insert the property into the database on engine startup, it would be more performant just to update the property and not go again through the exclusive lock logic. Also, no OptimisticLockingException is thrown with the exclusive lock approach, which is counterintuitive for the user.
timeline.author: tasso94
